I might have to rethink this function, a little experimentation with the 
fitness function gave much better results:

http://tinypic.com/etru3t.png

It's not perfect but it's a lot better and doesn't leave much room for 
measuring improvments. Having said that, often the difficulty is in 
achieving that last little bit of fitness so maybe the function does 
stand as a benchmark. All we need to do is use a fitness function (for 
reporting purposes at least) that puts more enphasis on little 
improvments near the target value over improvements further out.


Here's the result of another run I did using a sawtooth shaped function:

http://tinypic.com/etrxhv.png

Note how well the sharp edges have been approximated, which is a nice 
result considering a sigmoid activation fn is being used. One symptom of 
this can be seen on close inspection the straight rising edges of the 
teeth, which are slightly wavy.

Colin.
